title: How to Embed a SQL Query in Microsoft Excel

steps.title: Go to Data tab and select From Other Sources as shown in the screen shot below.
steps.content: Go to Data tab and select From Other Sources as shown in the screen shot below.

steps.title: Select “From Data Connection Wizard” in the drop down.
steps.content: Select “From Data Connection Wizard” in the drop down.

steps.title: Data Connection Wizard will open.
steps.content: Data Connection Wizard will open. Select “ODBC DSN” from the available option and click “Next”.

steps.title: Connect to ODBC Data Source window appears.
steps.content: Connect to ODBC Data Source window appears. Where a list of database available in our organization will be displayed. Select the appropriate database and click on “Next”.

steps.title: Select Database and Table window appears.
steps.content: Select Database and Table window appears.

steps.title: We can select the database and the table from where we wish to pull the data.
steps.content: We can select the database and the table from where we wish to pull the data. So, select the database and table as appropriate in our case.

steps.title: Select Finish in “Save Data Connection File and Finish” window.
steps.content: Select Finish in “Save Data Connection File and Finish” window. This window will pull up the File Name based on our selection in previous screens.

steps.title: Import Data window appears where we can select options as per our need and click OK.
steps.content: Import Data window appears where we can select options as per our need and click OK.

steps.title: Select “From Data Connection Wizard” in the drop down.
steps.content: Select “From Data Connection Wizard” in the drop down.

steps.title: Go to Data tab and Click on Connections.
steps.content: Go to Data tab and Click on Connections. Click on Properties in the following window.

steps.title: Go to Definitions tab in the following window.
steps.content: Go to Definitions tab in the following window.

steps.title: Write SQL query in “Command Text” and Click OK.
steps.content: Write SQL query in “Command Text” and Click OK. Excel will display the result as per the query.

steps.title: Now go to Microsoft Excel and validate if the results are as per the SQL Query written.
steps.content: Now go to Microsoft Excel and validate if the results are as per the SQL Query written.
